class src.core.scripts.Script(name=None, settings=None, instruments=None, scripts=None, log_function=None, data_path=None)[source]¶

Bases: PyQt4.QtCore.QObject

__init__(name=None, settings=None, instruments=None, scripts=None, log_function=None, data_path=None)[source]¶

executes scripts and stores script parameters and settings :param name: name of script, if not provided take name of function :type name: optional :param settings: a Parameter object that contains all the information needed in the script :type settings: optional :param instruments: instruments used in the script :type instruments: optional :param scripts: sub_scripts used in the script :type scripts: optional :param log_function: function reference that takes a string

__module__ = 'src.core.scripts'¶

Returns:a description of the script in form of a string

Returns:

time when script execution ended :return:

filename(appendix=None, create_if_not_existing=False)[source]¶

creates a filename based :param appendix: appendix for file

finished¶
get_axes_layout(figure_list)[source]¶

returns the axes objects the script needs to plot its data the default creates a single axes object on each figure This can/should be overwritten in a child script if more axes objects are needed :param figure_list: a list of figure objects

Returns:a list of axes objects
Return type:axes_list
get_axes_layout_validate(figure_list)[source]¶

creates the axes layout for the validation plots :param figure_list: list of figures :return: list of axes objects

static get_script_information(script_information)[source]¶

extracts all the relevant information from script_information and returns it as individual variables :param script_information: information of the script. This can be

  • a dictionary
  • a Script instance
  • name of Script class

Returns: module, script_class_name, script_settings, script_instruments, script_sub_scripts

instruments¶
Returns:instruments that the script uses as a dictionary
instrumets¶
Returns:instruments that the script uses as a dictionary
static load(filename, instruments=None)[source]¶

loads an script instance using pickle :param filename: source filename :param instruments:

optional - only needed if script requires instruments dictionary of form

instruments = { name_of_instrument_1 : instance_of_instrument_1, name_of_instrument_2 : instance_of_instrument_2, ... }

Returns:script_instance updated_instruments
static load_and_append(script_dict, scripts=None, instruments=None, log_function=None, data_path=None, raise_errors=False)[source]¶

load script from script_dict and append to scripts, if additional instruments are required create them and add them to instruments

Parameters:
  • script_dict –

    dictionary of form

    script_dict = { name_of_script_1 :

    {“settings” : settings_dictionary, “class” : name_of_class}
    name_of_instrument_2 :
    {“settings” : settings_dictionary, “class” : name_of_class}

    ... }

  • or – script_dict = { name_of_script_1 : name_of_class, name_of_script_2 : name_of_class ... }
  • name_of_class is either a class or the name of a class (where) –
  • scripts –

    dictionary of form

    scripts = { name_of_script_1 : instance_of_script_1, name_of_script_2 : instance_of_script_2, ... }

  • instruments –

    dictionary of form

    instruments = { name_of_instrument_1 : instance_of_instrument_1, name_of_instrument_2 : instance_of_instrument_2, ... }

  • log_function – function that takes a string
  • data_path – absolute path where data is saved, in case the path in the script is definded as a relative path
  • raise_errors – if True errors are raised
Returns:

dictionary of form script_dict = { name_of_script_1 : script_1_instance, name_of_script_2 : script_2_instance, ...} load_failed = {name_of_script_1: exception_1, name_of_script_2: exception_2, ....} updated_instruments = {name_of_instrument_1 : instance_of_instrument_1, ..}
static load_data(path)[source]¶

loads the data that has been save with Script.save. :param path: path to folder saved by Script.save or raw_data folder within

Returns:a dictionary with the data of form data = {param_1_name: param_1_data, ...}
static load_settings(path, setttings_only=True)[source]¶

loads the settings that has been save with Script.save_b26. :param path: path to folder saved by Script.save_b26 :param setttings_only: if true returns only the settings if the .b26 file contains only a single script

Returns:a dictionary with the settings
log(string)[source]¶

appends input string to log file and sends it to log function (self.log_function) Returns:

name¶

script name

plot(figure_list)[source]¶

plots the data contained in self.data, which should be a dictionary or a deque of dictionaries for the latter use the last entry

plot_validate(figure_list)[source]¶

plots the data contained in self.data, which should be a dictionary or a deque of dictionaries for the latter use the last entry

remaining_time¶

estimates the time remaining until script is finished

run()[source]¶

executes the script :return: boolean if execution of script finished succesfully

save(filename)[source]¶

saves the instance of the script to a file using pickle :param filename: target filename

save_b26(filename=None)[source]¶

saves the script settings to a file: filename is filename is not provided, it is created from internal function

save_data(filename=None, data_tag=None)[source]¶

saves the script data to a file filename: target filename, if not provided, it is created from internal function data_tag: string, if provided save only the data that matches the tag, otherwise save all data Returns:

save_image_to_disk(filename_1=None, filename_2=None)[source]¶

creates an image using the scripts plot function and writes it to the disk for single plots (plot_type: ‘main’, ‘aux’)

  • if no filname provided take default name
for double plots (plot_type: ‘main’, ‘aux’)
  • if no filnames provided take default name
  • if only one filname provided save only the plot for which name is provided
Parameters:
  • filename_1 – filname for figure 1
  • filename_2 – filname for figure 1

Returns: None

save_log(filename=None)[source]¶

save log to file Returns:

scripts¶
Returns:sub_scripts that the script uses as a dictionary
settings¶
Returns:returns the settings of the script

settings contain Parameters, Instruments and Scripts

start_time¶

time when script execution started

started¶
stop()[source]¶

stops itself and all the subscript

to_dict()[source]¶

Returns: itself as a dictionary

update(settings)[source]¶

updates the internal dictionary :param settings: parameters to be set

# mabe in the future: # Returns: boolean that is true if update successful

validate()[source]¶

function to validate of the script parameters are valid: this will most likely be removed in future versions :return: boolean
